title: MTV EMAs 2015: Duran Duran 'proud' to receive new MTV Video Visionary Award
text:
MTV EMAs 2015: Duran Duran 'proud' to receive new MTV Video Visionary Award MTV EMAs 2015: Duran Duran 'proud' to receive new MTV Video Visionary Award Share 
New Romantic icons Duran Duran will receive the first ever MTV Video Visionary Award. 
The trophy will be handed out tonight at this year’s MTV Europe Music Awards (EMAs) in Milan, Italy. 
The chart-topping 1980s band will be given the honour for their strong visual presence, and for influencing a generation of musicians with some of the best pioneering music videos of all time. Duran Duran with yet another award (Ian West/PA) 
Duran Duran, originally comprising Simon Le Bon, Nick Rhodes, John Taylor, Andy Taylor and Roger Taylor, released a statement about their accolade. 
“It is no coincidence that our rise was paralleled by the growth and ultimate world domination of MTV. The birth of music videos as a way to simultaneously bring our music to a global audience revolutionised the business,” the band said. . @duranduran will be the FIRST EVER honourees of the Video Visionary Award at the @mtvema ! https://t.co/Hgx1GuiqZp pic.twitter.com/4QQalyEe07 
— MTV UK (@MTVUK) October 23, 2015 
The statement continued: “We have worked with some of the most talented directors in the world – without whom we would not be honoured here today. We are really proud to be the recipients of this new award. Thank you, MTV.” Promoted stories 
Meanwhile, a good deal of anticipation surrounds Justin Bieber’s forthcoming performance because he broke down in tears at the MTV Video Music Awards (VMAs) in August. 
The Canadian pop star explained why he had been so overwhelmed on Jimmy Fallon’s The Tonight Show: “I just wasn’t expecting them to support me in the way they did. Last time I was at an awards show, I was booed.” 
After confirming his appearance at the EMAs, Justin said: “I’m excited to share this performance and this new material with my fans around the world. The EMAs are always a blast. I’m glad to be back and it’s going to be fun”. 
The star is due to release his new album Purpose on November 13, the same date as One Direction’s much-anticipated fifth studio album, Made In The AM. Ed Sheeran ( Joel Ryan/Invision/PA) 
Singer Ed Sheeran and model Ruby Rose will host the EMAs, which promises an intriguing battle between Taylor Swift, who has nine nominations, and Justin who has scored six nods. Here is the full list of nominees for this year’s EMAs: Best song 
Mark Ronson featuring Bruno Mars, Uptown Funk! 
Ellie Goulding, Love Me Like You Do 
Major Lazer & DJ Snake featuring Mo, Lean On 
Taylor Swift featuring Kendrick Lamar, Bad Blood 
Wiz Khalifa featuring Charlie Puth, See You Again Best pop
